column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE cautiously approaches a little shipwreck, crashed on rocks poking out of the ocean.
column5: Narrator : CAPITAINE cautiously approaches a little shipwreck that crashed on some pointy rocks poking out of the ocean.
Narrator : The mast of the boat, on the other hand, is still intact.

column3: Narrator : The ship is too small to sleep into.

column7: Narrator : The ship is too small to sleep into.

column9: Narrator : The mast is very slippery. CAPITAINE will have to climb carefully.

column11: Narrator : While climbing, CAPITAINE slips on the humid wood and falls down.

column1: Narrator : The interior of the boat is pitch black, CAPITAINE cannot see half a meter away.

column2: PlayerSpeak : I wish I had a lantern...

column1: PlayerSpeak : Let’s see what treasures this ship’s hiding!
Narrator : The room is richly decorated and filled with books. The ship must have been attacked by pirates.

column9: Narrator : CAPITAINE stands before a beautiful wooden door with intricate carvings. This must be an officer’s room.

column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE sees a beautiful bed, surrounded by staircases.

column3: Narrator : In the opposite wall, CAPITAINE spots a weapon rack in perfect condition.
column4: Narrator : CAPITAINE doesn’t find anything more than a chest, filled with miscellaneous objects.
column5: Narrator : CAPITAINE opens the crew's pantry.

column13: PlayerSpeak : I don’t have a key...

column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE enters the wreck, hoping its crew left something of use before fleeing the ship.

column3: PlayerSpeak : Something to defend ourselves with
column4: PlayerSpeak : Dressed and set for the winter
column6: PlayerSpeak : It looks like diaries, about NOMTRESOR

column2: PlayerSpeak : This is gonna feed us for a few days
column6: PlayerSpeak : The boat was sailing DIRECTIONTOFORMULA

column1: PlayerSpeak : The view is breathtaking from here!

column4: PlayerSpeak : I wish I had a spyglass...

column1: Narrator : NOMBATEAU faces the wreck of an immense vessel that was probably crewed by dozens of men in its time.

column2: Narrator : CAPITAINE finds a hay bed to spend the night on.
column3: PlayerSpeak : The hold is so deep that we can’t see the bottom of it.
PlayerSpeak : I can’t go down without a rope.
